Right now I have nothing but a downy white fuzz coming in, and it's not even covering my entire head... I'm 4 weeks PFC, it seems like it will be forever :(

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2012 12:05PM janiemomof2 wrote: Hi all... just catching up with everyone's posts. Julz - I had nausea with rads and I haven't started my tamoxifien yet so I brought it up to my RO and he said it can happen though it's not usually the number one complaint he hears. He also said that folks often chalk it up to something else but that it can happen with rad tx. Hair! I have the slightest little bit of hair, not bad for 6 weeks PFC and it makes for really easy showering after the beach :P Rads rash - ugh. I have it. It reminds me of sun poisoning. I've been putting stuff on it but honestly I think the body just needs time to heal..... WHICH - it will have plenty of because ---------- I HAD MY LAST RADS TODAY!!! Happy Dance!! :) Wishing everyone minimal se this week <3
Posts.Title: Summer 2012 RADS HANG OUT Stacie rgina

Posts.Content: janiemomof2 wrote: Hi, I wrote a little introduction on another thread but wanted to write here at the "Just Dx" thread. I do breast self exam but didn't pick up on anything... my mammogram found "something" that led to u/s that led to core biopsy (all inside of 2 days) which led to a phonecall on a Friday afternoon (1/20/12) that I have IDC (invasive ductal carcinoma). My head is spinning. The complete path report with receptors was finished today: ER+/PR+ Her2- After reaching out and looking for recommendations I have decided to go with the Rena Rowan Breast Center at Penn for my breast surgeon and oncologist. I feel fortunate to live in Philly where there are so many options for treatment. My appt is tomorrow and it can't come soon enough; I have so many questions. I'm so scared. I could just cry and cry and cry. I'm holding it in most of the day b/c we haven't talked to the kids yet (14 & 9), we were waiting to get a better sense from the BS about a clear path ahead so we could answer the kids' questions. This whole ordeal started with mammy & u/s on Monday the 16th and I've lost 6lbs since then b/c I'm so sick to my stomach all the time. The radiologist said the tumor is very far back against my chest wall and that it was hard to get to for the biopsy so my head is spinning about what that mean. I have been short of breath with such a tight feeling in my chest ever since the biopsy (18th). I try so hard to think positive but I'm terrified. I'm terrified that it is everywhere and they won't be able to help me. In the midst of all of these big emotions I'm trying to be a good advocate for myself and read all I can and make a list of questions to ask but right now my mind is blank. It's like I just want to curl up in the dark somewhere. bad day. janiemomof2 Dx 1/20/2012, IDC, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/5 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 1st appt with BS tmw afternoon - freaking out janiemomof2 mpeaches

Posts.Content: May 28, 2012 09:19AM janiemomof2 wrote: Hi everyone! Sorry for being MIA for awhile... #3 did such a number on me. Apparently, in addition to the wretched diarrhea I normally get for 7 or 8 days I had also contracted a norovirus. *what a nightmare* is all I can say!!! Between that and the complete exhaustion I have been pretty useless this round. Finally this weekend I am feeling "normal". Having my "good days" and trying to see everyone I can before I go back in for round #4 on Thursday the 31st. I am dreading it. Thinking about it makes me want to run away! LOL! I'm glad to see that there are a few of you that have finished up... I can't wait to be joining you. I will get a few weeks recovery and then it's onto radiation. I will be happy to put all of this behind me. Hope everyone is enjoying their weekend, it is beautiful in the Philadelphia area and I'm definitely enjoying it!!

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2012 10:01AM janiemomof2 wrote: UGH! Why am I still having such hotflashes???? I'm so sick of them. I'm on day 9 post 4th and final tx - all finished with meds, just about finished with any residual se and yet I continue to have these flashes? Anyone???
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2012 09:45AM janiemomof2 wrote: Swollen ankles and hair growth! Hey there... catching up on the posts and wanted to chime in on the two hot topics. I'm 3 weeks PFC and generally feeling ok, "normal", except for the fatigue - wow. I'm ready for my regular energy to return. Now, all of a sudden, yesterday I got pitting edema in my ankles. Not up my legs but all around the foot/ankle area. Never during tx but just now. Is it really from the Cytoxan? It's weird that it wouldn't have done it during tx! Not sure if I should call about it or wait to see if it gets better/worse. It just got really hot on the east coast so I'm sure they will dismiss it as the heat but truthfully, I NEVER get swollen from heat. And, I have white fuzzy growth on my head. Not much but it's definitely something. I even still have some small patches of stubble that never fell out after shaving my head. Nothing under my arms, my eyebrows and lashes are thinned but hanging in there. I'm kinda over being bald. It's too hot for the wig, I'm sick of my scarves. Mostly wearing a baseball hat but really ready to have hair again :( Hope everyone is doing well with minimal se!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2012 07:33AM janiemomof2 wrote: Hi everyone... I'm so sick of this insomnia!!!!! I've been up by 3 or 3:30am every morning since starting the bethamexasone. I think the hardest part is feeling so alone while everyone is sleeping. Then when my kids need my attention the most (in the afternoon - at dinnertime - at bedtime) I am *useless*. It's not doing my emotions/mood any good. I had TC #1 on Thursday and Neulasta on Friday. I'm doing ok, though I am already having quite a bit of bone pain, particularly in the sternum area. Betsie - I started Claritan yesterday as well. I will definitely have to start earliet next time. I'm trying to drink lots of water and I start everyday with a fresh Kale juice. I'm trying to stay active. But mostly I'm trying to just live my life; just with a lot more challenges it seems :/ I hope everyone is doing well this morning ~~~~
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 10:17AM janiemomof2 wrote: Checking in with everyone... Yesterday was kinda rough and it was only day 3 post tx #1 - oy! I had been awake since 3am and it was my daughter's 10th birthday party and I just struggled the whole day. I'm sure part of it was just exhaustion but also I was constipated so I took miralax---- woah! I can't believe how bad my cramps and pain were... it finally worked about 5 hours later but that was a tough few hours. I feel kinda achey and flu-like which they said would happen so although not unexpected it is still unpleasant :( Slak -- I did take the Ativan (1mg) last night and it helped! I only slept til 5am but I will take that over the usual 3am! I also took my Dex a bit earlier yesterday than I had been taking it, luckily today is my last dose of that until next round. As far as my Kale drink! Similar to Kim I use a strong blender (one of the older versions of the Vitamix - I would love an upgrade but the old school one works fine :) I put *alot* of Kale, whatever fresh fruit I have; usually strawberries, blueberries, mango.... also I like alot of fresh ginger it gives it such a nice bite. I add a couple heaping tablespoons of frozen apple juice concentrate and about 6 ounces of water. Yum-O! My DH and I start everyday with some version of that, it's pretty forgiving, you can put anything in there. Now, I have questions! This metallic taste has got to go!!! What are your best suggestions??? Also, what are your thoughts about this Neulasta pain? Mine has already begun which was surprising b/c I though it happens later! I've been using a hot water bottle and a hot rice sock but it's so deep that it only barely touches it. Ok, I hope everyone is having a good day

Posts.Content: May 6, 2012 09:44PM janiemomof2 wrote: Hi all, Finally catching up on all the posts since I haven't been on for awhile... I'm dreading Thursday - it's my tx #3 day and I have finally been feeling normal for the last 6 days and have been enjoying it so much. I can't believe I have to start the steroids in just a couple days... UGGGHHH. StayShiny and Slak - we are pretty close on schedules and I am having a similar experience with the ridiculous exhaustion and weight gain. And thanks for the heads up on the rads tattoos slak, I have that coming in June. Catherine, I've been thinking of you also... it's good to hear from you. I must agree that it has been a strange and isolating experience for me. I am *such* an extrovert but this experience has been quite the opposite experience, after treatment I go into such a introverted place, kinda depressed. Is that the meds? It is so strange for me. On the upside................ I graduated nursing school on Friday! I will be taking a prep class for boards between tx #3 and tx#4 and then taking the exam at the end of June. It's been quite the experience going through BC tx and nursing school. It has without question, changed the nurse I will be. Hope everyone is doing ok ~~~~ J.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 29, 2012 08:29AM janiemomof2 wrote: Jenny, I don't work full-time so I can't answer your question directly but I have been finishing up nursing school (graduated May 4th) and now in a full-time Kaplan Prep class for my boards that I take on the 18th. Plus, I homeschool my 2 kids. So, to me it's like I'm working full-time in terms of hours I'm responsible to someone/something else. All I can say is that I was managing ok through surgery/recovery and even through the first two rounds of tx. This last tx #3 kicked my butt and I could barely get out of bed for over a week. Luckily my DH could pick up the slack with the kids and I missed some crucial study days, but at the end of the day I'm not going to get "fired" for either of those balls dropped. I would work as long as you can but be open to the idea that your body may have other plans for you. Perhaps look into short term disability now so that if you need it at some point you have already done the leg-work for it. Kim - I hate those steriods!!!! They ALWAYS wake me at 3:30am too! Must be the witching hour for them. Good luck today... My #4 is on Thursday. I am dreading it!!! I want to be done but I also want to run away before Thursday gets here ;) Be well everyone!

I practically need to nap after moving from one room to the next! Otherwise the GI stuff has been far better this round than last (THANK GOD!) My bone pain in manageable but definitely giving me a run for my money. All in all, I guess mentally I'm dealing with it better b/c I know that I'm done with chemo. I'm sort of dreading rads just b/c the reports are all about exhaustion and I just want my energy back. Anyone else here finishing up their treatment with rads? I think I'm starting in a couple of weeks, would be nice to have some buddies along the way. Not that I'm wishing radiation on any of you ;)
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 07:04PM janiemomof2 wrote: Hi Pam, I feel your pain! Literally! I definitely wish I had more warning about the GI side effects... I didn't realize they would be as intense as they were, or last as long. here is my experience (everyone is different): Chemo #1 - March 29th... horrible constipation and upper abdominal pain through Monday (day 5) beginning on Tuesday (day 6) I was literally peeing out of my butt if I had a morsel of food, it didn't matter what it was. The diarrhea was accompanied with long periods of time on the toilet with horrible lower bowel cramping. I *thought* by day 8 that I was turning a corner so I went to a conference for school - big mistake - all I had was a banana and water and by 10:30am I was in the toilet at the conference center for an hour. I had to leave when I had a window of time to drive home. This was a very low moment and bad emotional day for me. I actually felt "attacked" by the treatment and like I had to live like a recluse. That level of diarrhea continued until I had a semi-normal but still soft stool yesterday morning (day 13). I have been fairly "normal" GI -wise yesterday to today which was just in time for the huge hair fallout that began on the evening of day 12. Today is day 14 and I'm feeling ok. I have a lingering headache for a day or two but otherwise I feel as close to normal since before the treatment. Of course I go back next week for tx #2 so the cycle will start all over again but I'm enjoying this sense of normalcy while I can. So, all in all I had about 5 days of constipation followed by about 6 days of diarrhea. Hopefully you are about in the clear - fingers crossed! I don't normally drink it but the red gatorade has been my best friend for the last week - it's been like virtual IV fluids. Good luck!!!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2012 08:41AM janiemomof2 wrote: slak - I hear you! I've been on an emotional roller coaster. Today is day 16 for me so we are pretty close to each other in the process. I started to get "down" while reading other threads on the boards about hair re-growth. Just how long it will take and how different it will be. But, what brought me out of it was my husband. We were talking and he said: "you know, when you come through all this crap to the other side you will have a lower chance of breast cancer than the regular population and that's pretty good odds". And, he's right. I have to focus on the long term b/c when I focus on the day to day I can get "stuck". kwim? Also, I try to remember what my Oncologist said when she first layed it all out at the beginning of dx and tx. "You are going to have a really bad year and then it will be over and you have the rest of your life". So, basically 2012 is going to suck. ONTO 2013!!! hang in there xoxo

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2012 06:54AM janiemomof2 wrote: The week that I'm having treatment I'm on Bethamexasone from Wednesday thru Sunday, it's tapered over the weekend. My treatments are on Thursdays. It makes me so wired and hungry... I swear I am gaining 5lbs a day! Today is day 6 post tx #2 and I'm starting with the soft bowel mvmts... hoping it doesn't go into the full blown diarrhea I had last time - that was ridiculous, I couldn't leave the bathroom! I need to go to school today, tmw & Thursday so I really need this to be under control. Here's hoping for a day of minimal s/e for all of us!!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2012 07:30PM janiemomof2 wrote: Hiker - that's crazy! I know for tx 1 and 2 the infusion nurse sat with me for awhile into the infusion to check for reaction but for 3 and 4 they just hooked me up and left b/c they said it's so rare to have a reaction that late.... if it's going to happen it happens by the 2nd time. I would talk to the MO about skipping the last round, it's worth having the conversation at least. If I could have skipped the last one I definitely would have! My hotflashes continue... I'm "only" 43 so I can't imagine this is any kind of real change just a continuation of the chemo effects I guess. I will have 5 years of Tammy coming my way but not until I finish rads so there are probably more hot flashes in my future. Speaking of RADS - I got the best news today!! I'm going to be doing the short course, just 16 sessions! I'm so happy - can't wait to be done with all of this!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2012 08:53AM janiemomof2 wrote: Good morning, Day 12 post first chemo for me. I am feeling more like myself than I have in weeks. Though, I'm still battling with the diarrhea, it's at least more manageable than it's been. I'm also so tired. I went to bed at 4pm yesterday after Easter festivities. I woke at 9pm, just for an hour and went back to sleep til 6am. And I NEVER nap! I guess this is a new world order. I am grateful this morning that I feel like I'll be able to accomplish something today, I have felt totally useless around the house and with the kids. Here is one issue I need to deal with though. I have a low level headache for a few days now. The MO doesn't want me to take Ibuprophen or Tylenol at all during tx. Her reasoning is that it can "cover up a fever". I'm not much of a pill taker to begin with so the idea of taking an Oxy for a headache seems ridiculous to me. And, I will be completely useless if I take that - I can't function. Any suggestions? I know it's not from dehydration b/c I am drinking about 3 liters of water a day in addition to gatorade and non-caff tea. Plus my morning Kale drink. Happy Monday!

Posts.Content: May 15, 2012 09:15AM janiemomof2 wrote: Oh GeorgiaMom - from your lips to God's ears on #4 being easier than #3.... I'm in hell ladies! This latest tx #3 on May 10th has absolutely owned me and my body. It has been horrible. For some reason I skipped right over those usual first few days of constipation and just went right into the worst diarrhea I have ever had in my life. I was so depleted and sleep deprived by Monday morning that my onc wanted me in the hospital. I got alot of fluids and they wanted a stool sample which for the first time in days I couldn't produce!! Probably b/c I had stopped eating in an effort to avoid going to the toilet. I was going multiple times an hour. So they sent me home with a container to get a sample at home. I was hoping it had all passed and I was done with it but no.... it all started up again last night and I went to the bathroom at least 10 times between 9pm and 5am this morning. I think the fluids helped me, I don't feel as "out of it" but I'm still really dizzy and kinda nauseous, probably from such little food. I feel like a rung out papertowel. Barely out of bed for the last 72 hours, missed Mother's Day :( and just all in all feeling crappy inside and out. This has definitely been the worst round for me, without question. I need to turn a corner, and soon.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 16, 2012 01:36PM janiemomof2 wrote: Thank you everyone for all the well wishes... this has been a tough round of tx! I hope I'm turning the corner, still having diarrhea but at least not as frequently. Fri/Sat/Sun I was going multiple times an hour around the clock. The no-sleep thing was definitely contributing to my very bad state of mind, despite trying Lunesta each of those nights (it didn't work). By Monday morning I was laying with the phone in my hand waiting to call the office at 8:30am as soon as they opened. They finally called me back around 10 and told me to come in for fluids and that I sounded dreadful. I got in there and they ran labs - all my numbers were good. They wanted a stool sample which would have to wait b/c I couldn't make it happen (ridiculous!). The fluids were a tremendous help and they sent me home saying that I was surely "turning the corner" but if it continued it might be an intestinal parasite and I would have to come back to be admitted for IV abx and more fluids. By Monday at 5pm I started having diarrhea, again, but at least it wasn't as bad as it had been. It only woke me 2x over night and I felt much more rested and able to think clearly. So much so that at the 4am episode I managed to gather a stool sample for them that my DH brought in at 8:30am, Tuesday morning. Luckily, it was negative for the biggies (C.Dif, etc). They said just keep drinking, eat bananas, rest, small meals, no dairy, no green leafy, basically the BRAT diet (bananas, rice, applesauce, toast) in small quantities. So that is what I continued to do all day yesterday and I did continue to have diarrhea but it was a bit more manageable b/c it was at least spaced out by a couple of hours, what a concept!? Feeling very fatigued and weak I decided last night that I was going to get a full night of sleep no matter what so I went with my old standby - Tylenol PM. The benedryl just does it for me and I am so glad I did it.... Slept from 9 or 10 last night until 5am this morning, I woke up feeling like a new woman and I think DH was relieved that it was the first day in many days that I wasn't snarling at him before the sun came up :) As of today I have continued to have quite a few episodes of diarrhea that are accompanied by cramps that rival labor pains. There was one point on the toilet that I thought to myself, wow - this is exactly what it felt like pushing out my daughter. Weird, I know. No fevers, no bad lab work, maintaining hydration as best I can, still on the 2nd floor most of the day - just in case. I'm getting stircrazy though, today is day #7 post tx #3 and I really want to feel normal again. My poor DH is running himself ragged and I can tell my kids are ready to feel the relief of me feeling better again. They have gotten used to me "bouncing back" and it is just not happening this time, at all. Here's hoping tomorrow is the beginning of that time...  lsharvey822 - you were asking what I've done so far... this may require a little background. Because I had such bad constipation with round #1 for so many days that finally got resolved with Miralax and colace (per the MO) but then through me into horrible diarrhea for about 3 days, I had tried with rounds 2 & 3 to head off such extremes. With round #2 I was able to take Miralax as a preventative the night before chemo and also the day of chemo. I think it definitely worked to avoid the horrible constipation of the first round. The MO had me hold the colace and just do miralax the following night and by day 3 I was having bm's and all was happy in the world. Once I was having a daily bm she told me to stop miralax so I did and I didn't really have any other GI issues. However, the 2nd round for me was really bad with feelings of fatigue, shortness of breath and weakness. On days 7 & 8 I did have diarrhea that kept me close to home but it was nothing compared to this last episode! So, here comes tx #4 and I think - Great! We'll do the miralax again the night before and after chemo and all will be well. WHY DIDN"T THAT WORK?! That's all I want to know. I did the exact same thing for this round #3 as I did for round #2 but had a disastrous outcome. The MO said that for #4 I may want to skip Miralax and just try colace before and after since it is more gentle (it isn't an actual laxative but a softener). This brings me to my question (sorry for such a ridiculously long post!): Those of you that have had success balancing side effects, especially the GI ones, what are you doing that works and what have you done that hasn't worked? I am very interested to hear from GeorgiaMom - did you do anything in particular in preparation for #4 that you think contributed to it going so smoothly? Lastly, re: immodium - my MO says with any diarrhea they always want to make sure it isn't a bacteria like C.Dif causing the diarrhea before they tell patients to use immodium which will just keep it in the body. That's why I had to do the stool sample. Now that it has been cleared as negative for all parasites I am technically "allowed" to use immodium but I'm inclined to jsut let it all come out if its coming. If I really needed to leave the house I would use it. Thanks for the support everyone, no one else in my life would either be interested or understand all this talk about poop!! LOL!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2012 08:28AM - edited Jun 3, 2012 02:33PM by janiemomof2 Well, I'm recouperating at my brother's beach house and I have to say that even with a touch a diarrhea this is a far more pleasant environment in which to recouperate!! I'm going way easy on the food and just drinking alot of water. I'm sooooo tired. That is truly the most cumulative, to piggyback on what others are saying. I walked down to the beach near the end of the day to meet up with DH and kids. I didn't even have to carry anything and I was so short of breath. My hgb is down a bit so I'm sure that's part of it but wowzers.... looking forward to feeling like the superwoman I usually feel like in life. I have a few weeks off until rads begin at the end of the month, hoping to get more "good days" out of this last round of chemo since round 3 rocked my world until just a few days before round 4. Hoping for minimal s/e for everyone and congrats for everyone who is done with this mess! xoxo

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2012 10:18AM janiemomof2 wrote: Hey all ~ Today is day 7 for me and I have now moved into the diarrhea portion of the program! Holy COW! After days of intense intestinal discomfort from constipation I awoke at 5am to this new exciting side effect. I had to go into school for a couple of hours and I am just happy that I made it back in time to sit on the throne again. Now I have a headache and I'm back in bed. I am so over this! Re: hair loss. I've have been wondering what the most "common" point would be. My b'day is this weekend (7th) so I guess there is a good chance I will still have hair for that! Not that we have any big plans or anything but it will be day 10 post 1st treatment so I really hope that I'm at least feeling well enough to eat or have a glass of wine.... right now, neither one of those things sound at all appealing :(

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2012 10:26AM janiemomof2 wrote: Pkate - thinking of you today as you start your first chemo... hang in there! I'm on day 7 and it's mostly been the GI stuff that is the hardest to deal with - constipation from the treatment and then diarrhea starting today. Otherwise I think I'm starting to turn a corner. There is a light at the end of the tunnel!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2012 01:03PM janiemomof2 wrote: Hi All ~ Thanks for support around the Headaches... I'm going to call today about it. ALSO - in other news......... my hair started falling out last night around 9pm and I had a good cry with my husband and went to bed. It is amazing how much one can "intellectualize" what "will" happen and just how radically different it FEELS when it does happen. Today is day 13 post tx #1 and it is like nuclear fallout today! Huge handfuls and I still have a big head of hair so its amazing how much I really must have, LOL! I'm not waiting for bald spots though... going to buzz cut it tonight and the hairdresser is going to cut and style the wig for me. I will try it for a bit but I have a feeling I'm not going to be much of a wig girl. I'm probably going to be a baseball hat kinda girl. Who knows! Catherine, I know just what you mean about the "good week". I'm finally starting to feel like myself again and I'm staring at that calendar b/c tx #2 is on April 19th. Good luck with #2, hope you don't have a bad reaction again :( Ttyl ~~~~ J.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2012 09:59PM janiemomof2 wrote: Well.... I did it! Shaved my head. It was strangely liberating. I changed my avatar to a pic so you can see it. My sister was with me so she's in the pic too :) Likeachickadee - LOVE that quote... perfect timing for me!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2012 07:15AM janiemomof2 wrote: Stay Shiny - I'm so lucky I get both!! After tx #1 I had constipation for 4 days followed by 5 days of uncontrollable diarrhea... soooo much fun! I did have better luck with the constipation this go around. I started on miralax and colace the day before tx #2 and have continued it until yesterday. Today is day 5 post tx #2 so just to be on the safe side I'm not going to take anymore constipation meds just in case I throw myself into a worse bout of diarrhea than I had last time. I'm doing the wait and see what my body is doing thing and then plan accordingly. I do take a probiotic 2x a day to keep the good flora going and have continued that through chemo. DianneNC - the steroids are horrible!!! My witching hour was 3am and I was UP for the DAY! I'm hoping with your 1:30am wake up that you were able to get back to sleep. Here's what I did for this second round of them.... My morning dose I take asap (sometimes 5am) so that I can take my "evening" dose by or before 3pm. When I do this I don't have *as much* trouble sleeping. Though, last night I could fall asleep which is weird for me, I did sleep from midnight til 6am so I actually feel rested. Good luck today with infusion!!! Have a great day all with minimal s/e!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2012 12:26PM janiemomof2 wrote: Stayshiny - OMG! I was just jumping on to say the same thing!! I literally couldn't get out of bed yesterday and I was weeping at the drop of a hat. I'm the opposite of a depressed person so it kinda freaked me out! I'm having a serious pity party... all I thought about yesterday is how sad I am, all the things I don't have energy for, how alone I feel, how I wish some of my friends would call to check on me. I'm not kidding - it was bad! Today is a bit better, though I'm definitely still "down". THis didn't happen like this exactly last time, this seems "more". Last time I had a moment of being overwhelmed about the side effects and cried to my hubby but this time feels a bit more isolating. I actually called the Breast Center and made an appointment with the psychologist, maybe I just need to get it all off my chest. Hope you can turn a corner... all we can do is put one foot in front of the other I guess... UGH!
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 10, 2012 07:17AM janiemomof2 wrote: Hey all! Chemo #3 today for me... hoping it runs as smoothly as #2 which was quite manageable (especially compared to the se after #1!) Georgia mom, sounds like #3 was rough for you! Glad that is in your rearview mirror. And to top it off you are FINISHED~~~ How exciting?! I'm right on your heels!  Stayshiny, when is your #4? My #4 (and final infusion) is on May 31st. I go in for my last neulasta on June 1st and then I'm heading to the beach for a week. S/e are just that bit more manageable with the sea air ;) COME ON JUNE!!!

Posts.Content: May 16, 2012 01:42PM janiemomof2 wrote: typo - ooops! in my hurry to be done with this darn chemo I wrote "So, here comes tx #4 and I think..." but I was talking about tx #3, the one I just had last week. I wish I could talk about treatment #4 in the past :(
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: May 31, 2012 09:47PM janiemomof2 wrote: What a long day!! Had my 4th and final infusion!!! WOOP WOOP! and for the first time they were running so far behind. They are normally so efficient but everything was 2 hours behind schedule. As if that weren't enough, I also had to go to RO office to sign some consents and then be sent to CT for my simulation. By then it was 4pm and I had been there since 8am... I was exhausted. Had to hold my arms over my head for 30 minutes, oy. But all in all the word of the day is grateful! So glad to be finished with this piece of it at least. Hoping for minimal side effects, just need a break from all that. Speaking of dog stories.... in the midst of getting my infusion I get a frantic call from my kids that our dog was having a seizure?! Full blown. Luckily my DH scooped him up and took him to the vet right away. They told him that it wasn't that unusal but they took some blood and gave a script for if it happens again. Any advice??? It just doesn't seem normal to have a seizure.... their under-reaction was kinda weird to me.
Posts.Title: March/April Chemo T/C x 4 Catherine22 Summer51

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2012 07:32PM janiemomof2 wrote: Jenny, It can be shocking just how much it can take it out of you. I would say, for me, the worst days were day 3-8 (counting infusion day as day #1). So, that first week of work after your infusions will be tough but once you hit the weekend you will see a return of some energy and something resembling "normal" or "good days". Hang in there and drinks LOTS of fluids... I was trying for like 5000mls a day in the first few days just to flush, flush, flush! Good luck, hang in there!
